form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Casey (for himself, Mr. Moran, Mr. Roberts, and Mr. Tester) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a credit against income tax for amounts paid by a spouse of a member of the Armed Forces for a new State license or certification required by reason of a permanent change in the duty station of such member to another State.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Military Spouse Job Continuity Act of 2015.

section.header: Credit for State licensure and certification costs of military spouses arising by reason of a permanent change in the duty station of the member of the Armed Forces to another State

subsection.text: Subpart B of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting after section 30D the following new section:

section.header: State licensure and certification costs of military spouse arising from transfer of member of Armed Forces to another State

subsection.text: In the case of an eligible individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the qualified relicensing costs of such individual which are paid or incurred by the taxpayer during the taxable year.
The credit allowed by this section with respect to each change of duty station shall not exceed $500.

paragraph.text: The term eligible individual means any individual—

subparagraph.text: who is married to a member of the Armed Forces of the United States at the time that the member moves to another State under a permanent change of station order, and
who moves to such other State with such member.

paragraph.text: The term qualified relicensing costs means costs—

subparagraph.text: which are for a license or certification required by the State referred to in paragraph (1) to engage in the profession that such individual engaged in while within the State from which the individual moved, and

which are paid or incurred during the period beginning on the date that the orders referred to in paragraph (1)(A) are issued and ending on the date which is 1 year after the reporting date specified in such orders.

subsection.text: The table of sections for such subpart A is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 30D the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 30E. State licensure and certification costs of military spouse arising from transfer of member of Armed Forces to another State..

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.
